com.mapzen.tangram

Class MapController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapzen.tangram.MapController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer

    public class MapController
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer
    MapController is the main class for interacting with a Tangram map.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  MapController.CameraAnimationCallback 
      static class  MapController.CameraType
      Options for changing the appearance of 3D geometry
      static class  MapController.DebugFlag
      Options for enabling debug rendering features
      static class  MapController.EaseType
      Options for interpolating map parameters
      static class  MapController.Error
      Options representing an error generated after from the map controller
      static interface  MapController.FrameCaptureCallback
      Callback for captureFrame(FrameCaptureCallback, boolean)
      static interface  MapController.SceneLoadListener
      Interface for listening to scene load status information.

      • captureFrame

        public void captureFrame(MapController.FrameCaptureCallback callback,
                         boolean waitForCompleteView)
        Capture MapView as Bitmap.
        Parameters:
        waitForCompleteView - Delay the capture until the view is fully loaded and no ease- or label-animation is running.

      • dispose

        protected void dispose()
        Responsible to dispose internals of MapController during Map teardown. If client code extends MapController and overrides this method, then it must call super.dispose()

      • getGLViewHolder

        public GLViewHolder getGLViewHolder()
        Returns the GLViewHolder instance for the client application, which can be further used to get the underlying GLSurfaceView or Client provided implementation for GLViewHolder, to forward any explicit view controls, example Transformations, etc.
        Returns:
        GLViewHolder used by the Map Renderer

      • loadSceneFile

        public int loadSceneFile(java.lang.String path)
        Load a new scene file synchronously. Use setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        Returns:
        Scene ID An identifier for the scene being loaded, the same value will be passed to MapController.SceneLoadListener.onSceneReady(int sceneId, SceneError sceneError) when loading is complete.

      • loadSceneFileAsync

        public int loadSceneFileAsync(java.lang.String path)
        Load a new scene file asynchronously. Use setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        Returns:
        Scene ID An identifier for the scene being loaded, the same value will be passed to MapController.SceneLoadListener.onSceneReady(int sceneId, SceneError sceneError) when loading is complete.

      • loadSceneFile

        public int loadSceneFile(java.lang.String path,
                         java.util.List<SceneUpdate> sceneUpdates)
        Load a new scene file synchronously. If scene updates triggers an error, they won't be applied. Use setSceneLoadListener(SceneLoadListener) for notification when the new scene is ready.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        sceneUpdates - List of SceneUpdate
        Returns:
        Scene ID An identifier for the scene being loaded, the same value will be passed to MapController.SceneLoadListener.onSceneReady(int sceneId, SceneError sceneError) when loading is complete.

      • loadSceneFileAsync

        Parameters:
        path - Location of the YAML scene file within the application assets
        sceneUpdates - List of SceneUpdate

      • flyToCameraPosition

        public void flyToCameraPosition(CameraPosition position,
                                MapController.CameraAnimationCallback callback)
        Smoothly animate over an arc to a new camera position for the map view FlyTo duration is calculated assuming speed of 1 unit and distance between the current and new positions
        Parameters:
        position - CameraPosition of the destination
        callback - Callback that will run when the animation is finished or canceled

      • flyToCameraPosition

        public void flyToCameraPosition(CameraPosition position,
                                int duration,
                                MapController.CameraAnimationCallback callback)
        Smoothly animate over an arc to a new camera position for the map view in provided time duration
        Parameters:
        position - CameraPosition of the destination
        duration - Time in milliseconds of the animation
        callback - Callback that will run when the animation is finished or canceled

      • flyToCameraPosition

        public void flyToCameraPosition(CameraPosition position,
                                MapController.CameraAnimationCallback callback,
                                float speed)
        Smoothly animate over an arc to a new camera position for the map view FlyTo duration is calculated using speed and distance between the current and new positions
        Parameters:
        position - CameraPosition of the destination
        callback - Callback that will run when the animation is finished or canceled
        speed - Scaling factor for animation duration (recommended range is 0.1 - 10)

        public CameraPosition getEnclosingCameraPosition(LngLat sw,
                                                 LngLat ne,
                                                 android.graphics.Rect padding)

        Parameters:
        sw - south-west coordinate
        ne - northwest coordinate
        padding - The minimum distance to keep between the bounds and the edges of the view
        Returns:
        The enclosing camera position

      • getMinimumZoomLevel

        public float getMinimumZoomLevel()
        Get the minimum zoom level of the map view. The default minimum zoom is 0.
        Returns:
        The zoom level

      • setMinimumZoomLevel

        public void setMinimumZoomLevel(float minimumZoom)
        Set the minimum zoom level of the map view. Values less than the default minimum zoom will be clamped. Assigning a value greater than the current maximum zoom will set the maximum zoom to this value.
        Parameters:
        minimumZoom - The zoom level

      • getMaximumZoomLevel

        public float getMaximumZoomLevel()
        Get the maximum zoom level of the map view. The default maximum zoom is 20.5.
        Returns:
        The zoom level

      • setMaximumZoomLevel

        public void setMaximumZoomLevel(float maximumZoom)
        Set the maximum zoom level of the map view. Values greater than the default maximum zoom will be clamped. Assigning a value less than the current minimum zoom will set the minimum zoom to this value.
        Parameters:
        maximumZoom - The zoom level

      • screenPositionToLngLat

        public LngLat screenPositionToLngLat(android.graphics.PointF screenPosition)
        Find the geographic coordinates corresponding to the given position on screen
        Parameters:
        screenPosition - Position in pixels from the top-left corner of the map area
        Returns:
        LngLat corresponding to the given point, or null if the screen position does not intersect a geographic location (this can happen at high tilt angles).

      • lngLatToScreenPosition

        public android.graphics.PointF lngLatToScreenPosition(LngLat lngLat)
        Find the position on screen corresponding to the given geographic coordinates
        Parameters:
        lngLat - Geographic coordinates
        Returns:
        Position in pixels from the top-left corner of the map area (the point may not lie within the viewable screen area)

      • addDataLayer

        public MapData addDataLayer(java.lang.String name)
        Construct a collection of drawable map features.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the data collection. Once added to a map, features from this MapData will be available from a data source with this name, just like a data source specified in a scene file. You cannot create more than one data source with the same name. If you call addDataLayer with the same name more than once, the same MapData object will be returned.

      • addDataLayer

        public MapData addDataLayer(java.lang.String name,
                            boolean generateCentroid)
        Construct a collection of drawable map features.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the data collection. Once added to a map, features from this
        generateCentroid - boolean to control label centroid generation for polygon geometry MapData will be available from a data source with this name, just like a data source specified in a scene file. You cannot create more than one data source with the same name. If you call addDataLayer with the same name more than once, the same MapData object will be returned.

      • requestRender

        public void requestRender()
        Manually trigger a re-draw of the map view Typically this does not need to be called from outside Tangram, see setRenderMode(int).

      • setRenderMode

        public void setRenderMode(int renderMode)
        Set whether the map view re-draws continuously Typically this does not need to be called from outside Tangram. The map automatically re-renders when the view changes or when any animation in the map requires rendering.
        Parameters:
        renderMode - Either 1, to render continuously, or 0, to render only when needed.

      • getTouchInput

        public TouchInput getTouchInput()
        Get the TouchInput for this map. TouchInput allows you to configure how gestures can move the map. You can set custom responders for any gesture type in TouchInput to override or extend the default behavior. Note that MapController assigns the default gesture responders for the pan, rotate, scale, and shove gestures. If you set custom responders for these gestures, the default responders will be replaced and those gestures will no longer move the map. To customize these gesture responders and preserve the default map movement behavior: create a new gesture responder, get the responder for that gesture from the MapController, and then in the new responder call the corresponding methods on the MapController gesture responder.
        Returns:
        The TouchInput.

      • getPanResponder

        public TouchInput.PanResponder getPanResponder()
        Get a responder for pan gestures

        public TouchInput.RotateResponder getRotateResponder()

      • useCachedGlState

        public void useCachedGlState(boolean use)
        Set whether the OpenGL state will be cached between subsequent frames. This improves rendering efficiency, but can cause errors if your application code makes OpenGL calls.
        Parameters:
        use - Whether to use a cached OpenGL state; false by default
